action: I want to be able to quickly restore business data in the event of a failure or disaster
reason: To prevent business suspension and loss of trust due to system downtime or data loss
acceptance_criteria: The backup function can only be configured by Administrator-privileged users.
Target data for backup (DB, files, configuration information) can be defined.
Backups can be executed on an automated schedule.
Schedule settings can be specified on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.
A manual backup execution function exists.
Backup execution logs are stored.
Backup files are stored with encryption.
Backup storage destinations can be set to a separate storage (different region).
Backup data transfer is conducted via HTTPS/TLS.
Integrity checks of backup data are performed.
Corrupted backups are automatically detected.
The backup retention period is configurable.
An automatic deletion function for old backups exists.
Personal information data is backed up in an encrypted state.
The system can continue to operate during backup execution.
Backup processing is implemented in a way that minimizes the load on the production DB.
The restore function is executable only by administrators.
A confirmation dialog is displayed before starting a restore.
The target date and time for restoration can be specified.
Restore processing guarantees transaction consistency.
Integrity checks are performed after the restoration is complete.
Restore operations are recorded in the audit log.
RPO (Recovery Point Objective) is defined.
RTO (Recovery Time Objective) is defined.
Disaster recovery switching procedures exist.
A failover function to a standby environment exists.
Failover operation logs are stored.
Notifications are sent to administrators if a backup fails.
Notifications are sent via email or monitoring system integration.
The backup API requires authentication.
Rate limiting is applied to API access.
Changes to backup settings are recorded in the audit log.
Direct access to backup data is prohibited.
Storage access is controlled by a least-privilege policy.
A tampering detection mechanism for backup data exists.
Periodic restoration tests are conducted.
Test results are recorded.
Backup history is maintained even when the system is down.
Backup-related logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
The success rate of backup processing is monitorable.
API responses do not include internal information.
Backup processing responses are subject to timeout management.
The design ensures that backup processing does not fail even under high load.
